text: I enjoy presenting myself to

the world as a Kenyan
because I'm proud of my roots.
My name is Olympiah Otieno,

and Iâ€™m a computer science student
at JKUAT in Nairobi, Kenya.

I would like to use
artificial intelligence

to improve the living
standards of Kenyans.
Hello.
Hi.
My name is Olympiah Otieno.
I'm from Himachal Pradesh, India.
I'm interested in artificial intelligence.
If they can do it, then I can do it too.

We've all heard about Silicon Valley
in the United States.

Kenya is also known as Silicon Savannah
because of the way

the tech industry has grown
in this country in these recent years.
I would like to be on the forefront

of creating systems that can 
actually help to bring change,

because I think we're facing
a lot of critical development issues.

After finishing the 
AWS AI & ML Scholarship program,
I wanted to put what I had learned

into practice to do something
that was impactful.

Agriculture being the
backbone of Kenya's economy.

I was like, why don't I touch
on the agricultural sector?
Due to crop diseases, the rate

at which the yields have been
dropping is devastating.

One of the major challenges that
these farmers face is lack of knowledge.

So my colleagues and I have made
a mobile application called iFARM that

incorporates image classification specific
to the crops that we grow in Kenya.

With AI, farmers are 
able to detect crop diseases,

get information that can help them
prevent the spread of the crop diseases
and help them get a large harvest.

Us Kenyans should be able to solve this
because we are affected directly.
If we adopt

this tradition of actually being able
to face our challenges on our own.

We should be able to solve future
challenges that may come up.
I'm actually excited to see

what I will be able to achieve
in the next couple of years.

Without the scholarship program,
I wouldn't have been able to apply

for these opportunities,
such as internships, dealing with data.
There are not a lot of women who are black

and in the tech industry who have achieved
great heights in this career path.

Just being able to imagine
that I'll be there.
It's amazing when you think about it.

The fact that I was able
to go through the program and gain

knowledge, it actually 
boosted my self-confidence.
And I now know that I am

capable of doing
well in this particular field.
